testcase.brief: Unset eth0 mode or disable mac-learning, check wired station
testcase.description:
Pre-Condition: Eth0 with access or 802.1q mode and mac-learning is enabled: Interface eth0 mode bridge-access/bridge-802.1q Interface eth0 mac-learning enable Set roaming cache time: roaming cache update-interval 60 ageout 2 PC be learned by eth0 AP connect with HM _debug auth basic _debug auth info _debug auth comm Debug telnet
Test Procedure: 1. Show interface eth0 mac-learning all to check PC 2. Show auth to check connected PC 4. Show route to check if exist corresponding route of PC 5. Unset eth0 mode by "no interface eth0 mode", show auth to check if default SO be removed, show interface eth0 mac-learning all and show route to check if corresponding route be removed, check if PC entry be removed from HM 6. Set interface eth0 to access or 802.1q mode again by "interface eth0 mode bridge-access/bridge-802.1q", show auth to check if default SO be bound to eth0, show interface eth0 mac-learning all and show route to check if corresponding route be added, check if PC be reported to HM again 7. Disable mac-learning of eth0 by "no interface eth0 mac-learning enable", show auth to check if default SO be removed, show interface eth0 mac-learning all and show route to check if corresponding route be removed, check if PC entry be removed from HM 8. Enable mac-learning again by " interface eth0 mac-learning ebale", show auth to check if default SO be bound to eth0, show interface eth0 mac-learning all and show route to check if corresponding route be added, check if PC be reported to HM again

step.desc: config BR with WAN interface, nat enable, config mgt0.1
step.telnet: -v "hive ${hive.name}" -v "interface mgt0 hive ${hive.name}" -v "interface mgt0.1 vlan ${br1.vpc1.vlan}" -v "interface mgt0.1 ip ${br1.br.mgt0.1.ip}/${br.lan.netmask}" -v "interface mgt0.1 dhcp-server ip-pool ${br1.br.mgt0.1.ip_pool_start} ${br1.br.mgt0.1.ip_pool_end}" -v "interface mgt0.1 dhcp-server options netmask 255.255.255.0" -v "interface mgt0.1 dhcp-server options default-gateway ${br1.br.mgt0.1.ip}" -v "interface mgt0.1 dhcp-server options dns1 ${pub.dns1.ip}" -v "interface mgt0.1 dhcp-server enable" -v "exec bypass-wan-hardening" -v "roaming cache update-interval 60 ageout 2"

step.desc: HTTP enable and connect to HM
step.telnet: -v "alg http enable" -v "capwap client enable" -v "capwap client server name ${pub.hm1.ip}"

step.desc: AP connect with HM
step.log-match: -ps p "RUN state: Connected securely to the CAPWAP server" -f ${log.dir}/${log.file}

step.desc: eth0 access br1.vpc1.vlan
step.telnet: -v "user-profile lan qos-policy def-user-qos vlan-id ${br1.vpc1.vlan} attribute 1" -v "security-object lan" -v "security-object lan default-user-profile-attr 1" -v "interface eth1 mode bridge-access user-profile-attribute 1" -v "interface eth1 mac-learning enable" -v "interface eth1 security-object lan"

step.desc: enable debug
step.console: -v "_debug auth basic" -v "_debug auth info" -v "_debug auth comm" -v "_debug capwap basic" -v "_debug capwap trap" -v "clear log buf"

step.desc: 1. Connect a PC to switch
get eth1 ip of br
get eth1 ip of br
step.setvar: echo $(echo $(echo $(echo ${br1.vpc1.tif.mac1} | cut -d : -f1)$(echo ${br1.vpc1.tif.mac1} | cut -d : -f2,3)$(echo ${br1.vpc1.tif.mac1} | cut -d : -f4,5)$(echo ${br1.vpc1.tif.mac1} | cut -d : -f6)) | tr "A-F" "a-f")

step.desc: set br1.vpc1.tif.ip var for vpc1 on BR side
vpc ping br
Show interface eth1 mac-learning all to check PC
Show auth to check PC
Show route to check if exist corresponding route of PC
Check if connected client be reported to HM(?)
step.log-match: -b "trap ifname :eth1" -ps p "trap client channel :0" p "trap user profile id :1" p "trap client vlan id :${br1.vpc1.vlan}" p "trap client ip:${br1.vpc1.tif.ip}" p "trap remote id:${br1.vpc1.tif.mac}" -e "Station ${br1.vpc1.tif.mac} is authenticated to[a-fA-F0-9: ]+thru SSID lan" -f ${log.dir}/${log.file}

step.desc: Disconnect PC
step.telnet: -v "no interface eth1 security-object lan" -v "no interface eth1 mode"

step.desc: show interface eth1 mac-learning all to check if PC be removed
show auth to check if PC be removed
Show route to check if corresponding route be removed
Connect PC again, check client info
step.telnet: -v "interface eth1 mode bridge-access user-profile-attribute 1" -v "interface eth1 security-object lan"

step.desc: Connect a PC to switch
vpc ping br
show interface eth1 mac-learning all to check PC
show auth to check PC
Show route to check if exist corresponding route of PC
Disable mac-learning of eth1
show interface eth1 mac-learning all to check if PC be removed
show auth to check if PC be removed
Show route to check if corresponding route be removed
Enable mac-learning again
vpc ping br
show interface eth1 mac-learning all to check PC
show auth to check PC
Show route to check if exist corresponding route of PC
